1.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and wilt hide my commands with thee;

2.text: To attend to wisdom thou wilt incline thine ear, thy heart to understanding;

3.text: For if thou will call to understanding, wilt give thy voice to understanding.

4.text: If thou wilt seek her as silver, and dig for her as hidden treasure;

5.text: Then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah, and thou shalt find the knowledge of God.

6.text: For Jehovah will give wisdom: from his mouth knowledge and understanding.

7.text: He treasured up deliverance for the upright: a shield to those going in uprightness:

8.text: To guard the paths of judgment, and he will watch the way of his godly ones.

9.text: Then thou shalt understand justice and judgment and uprightness; every good track.

10.text: For wisdom shall come into thy heart, and knowledge shall be pleasant to thy soul.

11.text: Meditation shall watch over thee, understanding shall guard thee:

12.text: To deliver thee from the evil way, from the man speaking deceit;

13.text: Those forsaking the paths of straightness to go in the ways of darkness;

14.text: Those rejoicing to do evil will exult in the deceit of evil;

15.text: Whose paths are perverted, and in their tracks are bent aside:

16.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, from the stranger making smooth her sayings;

17.text: Forsaking the friend of her youth, and forgetting the covenant of her God.

18.text: For her house sunk down to death, and her tracks to the shades.

19.text: All going in it shall not turn back, and they shall not overtake the paths of life.

20.text: So that thou shalt go in the way of the good, and thou shalt watch the paths of the just.

21.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the blameless shall remain in it.

22.text: And the unjust shall be cut off from the land, and they transgressing shall be wiped off from it.
